required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of CPD MNV as an Aid in the Diagnosis and Risk Assessment of Sepsis (Protocol # Sepsis 1-14)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of CPD (Cell Population Data) MNV (Mean Neutrophil Volume) as an Aid in the Diagnosis and Risk Assessment of Sepsis (Protocol # Sepsis 1-14)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that CPD parameters will provide improved prediction of sepsis compared to currently employed laboratory parameters. These studies hold the potential to shape practitioner guidelines and improve the timeliness and accuracy with which patients with sepsis are treated today.

primary_outcome.measure: We are measuring CBC (complete blood count) and MNV (Mean Neutrophil Volume)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the clinical utility of CPD MNV as an aid in the diagnosis and risk assessment of Emergency Department patients for progression to sepsis, severe sepsis and septic shock.

clinical_study.condition: Sepsis, Severe Sepsis and Septic Shock

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult (â‰¥18 to 90 years)
- Patients presenting to the Emergency Department
- CBC (Complete Blood Count) with differential testing performed and CPD data retrieved
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously enrolled in this study

facility.name: Wexner Medical Center at The Ohio State University
